statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.headline: Vermont 92, Niagara 70
article.story: BURLINGTON, Vt. -- Four McGlynn scored 20 points to lead five Vermont players in double figures as the Catamounts beat Niagara 92-70 on Saturday for its 10th straight win. Matt Glass had 19, Clancy Rugg 15, Luke Apfeld 14 and Brendan Bald 11 for Vermont (19-10) in the Bracket Busters matchup. McGlynn connected on six 3-pointers while Rugg grabbed 12 boards to lead Vermont to a 42-22 rebounding advantage. Vermont jumped out to an early 13-3 lead and pushed that lead to 16, 23-7, behind a 3-pointer from Bald. Niagara (12-17) cut the deficit to 31-22 but Vermont outscored the Eagles 21-7 over the final 6:34 of the first half to take a 52-29 lead into halftime. Vermont led by at least 18 points throughout the entire second half. The Catamounts converted 20 of 22 free throws. Antoine Mason led Niagara with 20 points and Malcolm Lemmons had 17.
